intro: Fimbristylis annua f. oblonga, commonly known as the narrow-leaved flat sedge, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly referred to as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in wet or moist environments such as marshes, swamps, and along the edges of water bodies. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
